question_text: Which of the following statements accurately describe metered pricing in cloud computing? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: You pay based on actual resource consumption
Cost is independent of usage level
Higher egress traffic increases total cost
It typically includes fixed monthly fees
Storage and bandwidth are often separately billed
correct_answer: You pay based on actual resource consumption
Higher egress traffic increases total cost
Storage and bandwidth are often separately billed
explanation: Metered pricing links charges directly to usage â€” including compute time, egress bandwidth, and storage. Fixed-fee models are characteristic of non-metered pricing.
